content: Is it possible to read https://forge.rust-lang.org/ to know when current nightly (1.51) will be promoted to beta? Is it just the same date when current beta (1.50) is promoted to release?
https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/process.html#bump-the-stable-version-number-t-6-days-friday-the-week-before - see the src/version number, once it is 1.52 then it is effectively promoted.
I think https://forge.rust-lang.org/release/process.html#promote-master-to-beta-t-2-days-tuesday is specifically the point I'm interested in, but this is great. Thanks much!
Hm, well, I guess it depends on what you want - when that happens, we promote the last commit to have 1.51.

The point I want to know is when installing a beta with rustup will give me 1.51 instead of 1.50. (My actual goal here is to put a reminder on my calendar to add beta testing to a crate that uses const generics.)
Then, yes, roughly tuesday/wednesday is the right day.
The failure mode here if I'm off by a day isn't really anything, but also I'm impatient :-)
Iâ€™ve looked at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/beta/src/version a couple times in the past to check if a given branch had happened yet
